DataElement.preferredName: Largest Cyst  Distance From Nipple CM Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Define the axis for measurement (i.e. measurement is from nipple to superior margin of cyst) from the nipple to center of the largest cyst found in the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Distinguishing qualities of the greatest sized cyst found in an imaging study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.:(sist) A sac or capsule filled with fluid.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.
A sac-like closed membranous structure that may be empty or contain fluid or amorphous material.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/27/09 - released for reuse by DCP.  3/20/07 - Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lesion Distance From Nipple CM Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Depth from skin to center of cyst (to nearest 0.5 cm) [Manually-curated]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point.:The pigmented projection on the surface of the breast. Ducts that conduct milk from the mammary glands to the surface of the breast exit through the nipple. (from MedTerms Medical Dictionary; medterms.com):Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
The pigmented protuberance on the surface of the breast through which milk is drawn from the breast.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/31/12 jc  Released as part of draft VD review with Tina Taylor.  3/20/07 jc Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Distance from nipple [distanc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Distance from nipple [distance of largest cyst]

DataElement.changeDescription: 10/14/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN Breast Ultrasound CSI; added equivalent modality and Under Review ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc   10/31/12 Released as part of draft VD review with Tina Taylor.  3/20/07 jc Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task.
